name: Amplifiers
description: Sub-sector template for amplifier patents (CPC H03F*) including operational amplifiers, power amplifiers, and LNAs.
contextDescription: Amplifier patents cover signal amplification across all electronic systems. Key types include operational amplifiers (op-amps), power amplifiers (PA), low-noise amplifiers (LNA), variable gain amplifiers (VGA), and transimpedance amplifiers (TIA). High-value targets include Analog Devices, Texas Instruments, Qualcomm (RF PA/LNA), Skyworks, and all RF front-end vendors.
scoringGuidance: Op-amp patents are fundamental and ubiquitous - in virtually every analog circuit.
RF power amplifier patents target every wireless device (smartphones, WiFi, cellular).
LNA patents are critical for receiver sensitivity in wireless systems.
Class-D audio amplifiers are in all mobile devices and smart speakers.
High-speed amplifiers target data center (SerDes, optical) applications.

questions.question: What amplifier type does this patent cover? Score by market size: 1-3 for specialized, 4-6 for common (instrumentation, buffer), 7-10 for high-volume (op-amp, PA, LNA).
questions.reasoningPrompt: Identify the amplifier type and its market prevalence.

questions.question: Is this an RF amplifier patent (PA, LNA, driver)? RF amplifiers are in every wireless device.
questions.reasoningPrompt: RF amplifiers target Qualcomm, Skyworks, Qorvo. Identify RF applications.

questions.question: What key performance does this patent improve (gain, noise, linearity, efficiency, bandwidth)?
Is this amplifier CMOS-compatible for SoC integration? CMOS integration enables high-volume markets.
questions.reasoningPrompt: CMOS integration is key for mobile SoCs.
